byline.contributor: John Eligon reported from Minneapolis, and Ashley Southall from New York. Christina Capecchi contributed reporting from Minneapolis.
byline.original: By JOHN ELIGON and ASHLEY SOUTHALL

abstract: Minneapolis police arrest three people in connection with shooting of five during Black Lives Matter protest outside city's police precinct; demonstrators gather back on street and tensions remain high as activists question degree to which police are safeguarding those participating in peaceful demonstrations.
lead_paragraph: Three men were arrested after gunfire at a demonstration in Minneapolis left five victims with injuries that were not considered life-threatening.

headline.main: Black Lives Matter Activists Vow Not to Cower After 5 Are Shot
headline.print_headline: Activists Vow Not to Cower After Five Are Shot

snippet: Three men were arrested after gunfire at a demonstration in Minneapolis left five victims with injuries that were not considered life-threatening.
